titleStmt.title: A charme for Canterburian spirits, which (since the death of this arch-prelate) have appeared in sundry shapes, and haunted divers houses in the city of London. With his graces waftage over the Red Sea of Cocitus in Charons Ferry-boat; and his magnificent entertainment into the dæmoniack court.
titleStmt.author: Charleton, Job, Sir, 1614-1697.

titleStmt.title: A charme for Canterburian spirits, which (since the death of this arch-prelate) have appeared in sundry shapes, and haunted divers houses in the city of London. With his graces waftage over the Red Sea of Cocitus in Charons Ferry-boat; and his magnificent entertainment into the dæmoniack court.
titleStmt.author: Charleton, Job, Sir, 1614-1697.

notesStmt.note: Attributed to Sir Job Charleton by Wing.
Annotation on Thomason copy: "1644"; the 5 in imprint date is crossed out.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
